components.description:
Sheets of white, printed paper with variously colored tabs to bookmark important sections or indicate signature lines. Commonly used for content concerning various types of documents and writing.

The number of pages and tabs vary, with Microsoft and Twitter’s designs featuring one page with a single, purple-colored tab. Facebook’s is printed with NDA, or nondisclosure agreement. Most platforms indicate text with dark lines. Apple’s design features an easter egg, addressed Dear Katie and signed Take care from John Appleseed with the text of its 1997–2002 Crazy Ones/Think Different ad campaign:

Here’s to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They’re not fond of rules. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can’t do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the ones who are crazy enough to think that they can change the world, are the ones who do.

Early designs from au by KDDI resemble ðŸ“ƒ Page With Curl.

Not to be confused with ðŸ“„ Page Facing Up or other emojis featuring sheets of paper.
components.title: Bookmark Tabs

title: Bookmark Tabs

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Office symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Bookmark tabs, stuck to pages of a book or document. These indicate important sections, or that a signature or other action must be taken in http://emojipedia.org/bookmark-tabs/
emoji_net_data.name: bookmark tabs

bn:00105602a: Neat and tidy; especially used of hair

bn:13703758v: To mark or write on (something) using a marker

bn:00092424v: Interpret something that is written or printed

bn:00090151v: Attach a tag or label to
To apply a marker to content or items (like photos or text) to identify certain types of information.

bn:13759356v: To add something to one's Favorites folder.
To add to one's list of favorites on a website that allows users to compile such lists.

bn:00120018n: Allows multiple documents to be contained within a single window

In interface design, a tabbed document interface or Tab is a graphical control element that allows multiple documents or panels to be contained within a single window, using tabs as a navigational widget for switching between sets of documents.
A visual marker in a computer application
A navigational widget for switching between sets of controls or documents.
A clickable UI element designed to look like a tab on a file folder. Tabs are usually arranged horizontally and allow users to switch between related pages or webpages.

bn:00053456n: Some conspicuous object used to distinguish or mark something
An object used to mark a location.

bn:00012136n: A slip of paper, card, etc. used to mark one's place in reading a book; a bookmark.
A Bookmark is a thin marker, commonly made of card, leather, or fabric, used to keep the reader's place in a book and to enable the reader to return to it with ease.
A thin marker used to keep one's place in a printed work and to be able to return to it with ease.
A strip of material used to mark a place in a book.
Strip used to mark a place in a book.
A marker (a piece of paper or ribbon) placed between the pages of a book to mark the reader's place
